p:
There were both a positive and a negative control. Positive control was the natural insecticide causing the highest mortality on beet armyworm larvae according to the literature.
12 Negative control was the solvent used to extract the natural compounds tested in the bioassays. Schultz Insecticide, Houseplant & Indoor Garden Insect Spray (Premier Tech Home & Garden Inc., Brantford, Canada) was used as positive control. This product contains 0.02% pyrethrins [organic compound derived from dried flower heads of Chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium (Trevir.) Vis. (Asterales: Asteraceae)] as active ingredient and 0.20% PbO as synergist. Schultz Insecticide, Houseplant & Indoor Garden Insect Spray was purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Corporation (Canada) with a 98 to 100% purity.
